At first launch, it is necessary to configure the application in the administrator workspace. Click here for accessing the administrator workspace Safe mode Safe mode The application could not initialize correctly and started in safe mode. You should check application's logs and settings. Manage the application Information The application configuration is incomplete. Use the configuration tool to complete it. Information The application configuration is incomplete or incorrect. Use the configuration tool to complete it. Attention The application is in safe mode because one or more plugins has an incorrect configuration. You can watch logs to know more. Attention The application is in safe mode because it can not be initialized correctly due to an error. You can watch logs to know more. Attention The application is in safe mode because the configuration file 'WEB-INF/param/runtime.xml' was not loaded correctly. You can watch logs to know more. Information The application is in safe mode. Browser not compatible Sorry… This application does not support your browser or the version you are using{0}. Here is the list of supported browsers: Microsoft Internet Explorer Mozilla Firefox Google Chrome Apple Safari Opera Microsoft Edge Consult the user manual of your application to know the recommended browsers. Production Development m/d/y m/d/Y l, F j, Y h:i A h:i:s A h:i:sP A m/d/y h:i:s A m/d/Y \\\\a\\\\t h:i A m/d/Y h:i:s A P l, F j, Y \\\\a\\\\t h:i:s A P Process error An error occurred while processing server response No response from the server Server response is incomplete and has no information to continue the process correctly. Server response is inconsistent and that could come from:\n* your authentication that has expired,\n* an unknown issue on the server.\nYou can try to authenticate now before trying again.\n\nIf all your data are saved, click on Cancel.\n\nElse you can click on Ok to try to save again your running modifications but your application will be unstable (if you met this message several times, contact your administrator to have details on the problem duration). Server failed (code The connection to the server is down but the server may still be running your request.\n\nIf all your data are saved, click on Cancel.\n\nElse you can click on Ok to try to save again your running modifications but your application will be unstable (if you met this message several times, contact your administrator to have details on the problem duration). The connection with the server was lost The application became unstable and has stopped Communication error with the server. There is no response from the server A request left to the server from a few seconds but no response came back. You can cancel this request or you can wait for a few more seconds. You should also restart your application by reloading your browser.
If you have work in progress, you can try to save it. Server update The Ametys server was updated and restarted. This can lead to your application instability.

It is STRONGLY recommended to restart your application by reloading your browser.
If you have work in progress, you can try to save it. Server reset Reload the application Reload the browser to reset your application Are you sure? Do you want to reload the application now?

A figure on the ribbon icon displays the number of unread message. The color indicates the most serious message type among these unread messages: red for error, yellow for warning, and blue for simple information. Run a script Run a script through the script tool. About Ok Version: at An error occurred while retrieving information of versions and licensing Populations Population Actions Add Add a new user population Edit Edit a user population Remove Remove a user population This population cannot be removed because it is linked to a context Population enabled Enable a user population Disable a user population This population can not be activated because its configuration is invalid. A server error occurred preventing to know the current status of the population. Populations allowed to connect Allow to choose the user populations able to connect to the application Populations Display the user populations of the application Label Identifier User directories Authentication modes Used Enabled Disabled New population of users Edit population of users < Previous Next > Validate Cancel A user population is the grouping of user directories from different datasources (LDAP, SQL...) with the methods used to authenticate them.
For instance, users from a LDAP authenticated by CAS.

once your population is created, you would be able to link it to one or several contexts.

It is not necessary to gather the TOTO in one population.
For instance, if you wish to have userrs from LDAP authenticated by CAS, and users form SQL database authenticated with Form, it is recommended to create two separate populations.

Choose the label of the new user population you want to create. Label User population label Advanced > Advanced < You can choose the identifier associated to the population or use the one proposed by default.
The identifier must be unique so as to distinguish the users sharing the same 'login' in two different populations For instance, 'ldap/admin' and 'mysql/admin' are two separate users with separate rights and with the same login 'admin' (one form the LDAP and one from the MySQl database).
Once created, this identifier will no longer be editable.

Identifier Unique identifier of the user population Invalid identifier. It must begin with a lowercase letter and can only contain alphanumeric characters, underscore and dash. The identifier already exists for another population. Please choose another one. Select and parameterize the user directory(ies) which compose your population.

A login must be unique in a population. Thus, if you configure le user directories ActiveDirectory + Oracle, you have to make sure the logins of the ActiveDirectory are separate from the ones of the SQL database.
In case of doubt about the unicity, it is recommended to create separate populations. User directory User directory Add a user directory Remove the user directory User directory Type of user directory Authentication of users Authentication of users Add an authentication mode Remove an authentication mode Authentication mode Authentication mode Select and parameterize the modes of user authentication associated to the previously selected directories.

You have to make sure the given information is consistent. For instance, if you selected users from MySQL database, and you wish them to authenticate by CAS, it is necessary the CAS uses the same database.
If you propose several authentication modes, the user will have the choice: for instance CAS or Form. Remove the user population Are you sure you want to delete this user population ? Choice of user populations Select below the user population(s) allowed to connect to the application: Misconfigured population This population can not be activated because its configuration is invalid.
